snippet: Fifteen months into the pontificate of Pope Francis, the Roman Catholic bishops of the United States find themselves unsettled in ways large and small.
abstract: Roman Catholic bishops of the United States are grappling with the substantive and stylistic implications of Pope Francis's still-new papacy at their semiannual meeting in New Orleans; fifteen months into pontificate of Francis, bishops find themselves revisiting both how they live and what they talk about in light of Francis's emphasis on personal humility and economic justice.
lead_paragraph: Fifteen months into the pontificate of Pope Francis, the Roman Catholic bishops of the United States find themselves unsettled in ways large and small.

headline.main: U.S. Bishops Seek to Match Vatican in Shifting Tone
headline.print_headline: U.S. Bishops Seek to Match Vatican in Shifting Tone

keywords.value: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops
